title: i18n Framework Setup
description: Install and configure react-i18next. Create namespace structure, extract all hardcoded strings into translation keys, and add language toggle.
acceptance_criteria: Namespace files: common.json, shopping.json, tasks.json, vouchers.json, settings.json for both en/ and he/
All hardcoded UI strings replaced with t() calls
Language toggle in Settings (English / Hebrew) persisted in localStorage
Language change applies without page reload
Context engine keywords have translation keys
Bubble labels and starter pack items have translation keys
files_to_touch: src/i18n/he/*.json (create namespace files with empty/placeholder values)
All component files (replace hardcoded strings with t() calls)
completion_summary: Installed react-i18next + i18next. Created src/i18n/config.ts with fallbackLng:'en', returnNull:false, returnEmptyString:false for production safety. Created 6 namespace JSON files (common, shopping, tasks, vouchers, reservations, settings) in both en/ and he/ (HE is placeholder copies of EN — real translations come in fe-006). Added './i18n/config' import to main.tsx. Applied useTranslation() to all 6 production components: App.tsx, ShoppingHub.tsx, TasksHub.tsx, VouchersHub.tsx, VoucherList.tsx, SettingsModal.tsx — plus all 8 new components created in fe-001/fe-002/fe-003. Added language toggle in SettingsModal (EN/HE pill buttons, persisted to localStorage as 'homehub-lang', applied without page reload via i18n.changeLanguage()). All plural forms use i18next count interpolation (activeList_one/other, activeTask_one/other, etc.). Zero tsc errors. Production-safe: English strings are identical to prior hardcoded values.
notes: Start with English translations (copy current strings). Hebrew translations come in fe-006. This task is about infrastructure, not translation quality.
